featured.text: In this line of work, the person is paid to do daring actions that are deemed too 21 for the regular actor to perform, including jumping from heights, crashing cars, or fighting with weapons.
Plant diseases can also spread through tiny water drops that jump off leaves— a plant’s version of a sneeze.
I jumped out of the car, ran round to open the trunk and there inside 40 .
Since then, other companies have jumped on the bandwagon to promote everything from soft drinks to new clothes as a 27 .

other.text: The donkey jumped into the stream to cool ___(32)___.
They threw, jumped, and slung them around their bodies as we do today.
The skydiver managed to land safely after jumping out of the aircraft, even though her _____ failed to open in midair.

definition.zh_def: 跳躍，從一個地方向上或向前移動，通常是用雙腿或單腿。
definition.en_def: To push oneself off the ground and into the air using the legs.
definition.example: The children love to jump on the trampoline.
